title: How to Make a Durian Pancake

steps.headline: Combine flour and salt in a container and stir until everything is blended.
steps.description: Then put in the eggs one at a time, stirring constantly until smooth.

steps.headline: Pour the milk slowly and stir until the dough does not clot.
steps.description: Mix in pandan paste. Stir again until the dough is smooth.

steps.headline: Heat a non-stick frying pan to cook the batter so that it becomes like a spring roll skin approximately the diameter of a flat non-stick frying pan 24 centimeter (9.4 in).
steps.description: Turn on a small fire. Then spread a little margarine on the entire surface.

steps.headline: Take about 50 milliliters (2  fl oz) of the batter and pour into the pan when it is hot.
steps.description: Roll out the batter into a thin omelette. Cook for 2 minutes until the batter is completed.

steps.headline: Take a sheet of omelette and put 1 tablespoon of whipped cream in the middle of the pancake.
steps.description: Flatten. Add another 2 tablespoons of durian flesh on the top of the whipped cream.

steps.headline: Fold the omelette just like you would fold an envelope.
steps.description: Then move them together. Put in the refrigerator until the pancakes rather dense. Your durian pancake is ready to serve.

text: Combine flour and salt in a container and stir until everything is blended. Then put in the eggs one at a time, stirring constantly until smooth. Pour the milk slowly and stir until the dough does not clot. Mix in pandan paste. Stir again until the dough is smooth. Heat a non-stick frying pan to cook the batter so that it becomes like a spring roll skin approximately the diameter of a flat non-stick frying pan 24 centimeter (9.4 in). Turn on a small fire. Then spread a little margarine on the entire surface. Take about 50 milliliters (2  fl oz) of the batter and pour into the pan when it is hot. Roll out the batter into a thin omelette. Cook for 2 minutes until the batter is completed. Take a sheet of omelette and put 1 tablespoon of whipped cream in the middle of the pancake. Flatten. Add another 2 tablespoons of durian flesh on the top of the whipped cream. Fold the omelette just like you would fold an envelope. Then move them together. Put in the refrigerator until the pancakes rather dense. Your durian pancake is ready to serve. Finished.
